content: I was wondering if it's possible to find out where the type of an hir::Expr was determined/inferred from? (I'm guessing not but I thought I'd ask. For context if curious, I'm trying to work on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/7079 and want to check if we only know the type because it's named in the argument to unwrap_or.)

Hello, sorry for the late response. I don't know if you are still working on this, but looking at the issue, you should check if it is using Default::default or SomeType::default. If the latter is used, then you suggest let a: SomeType = opt_expr.unwrap_or_default(), if the former is used, then you can suggest let a = opt_expr.unwrap_or_default().

Hi :smile: — (I am still working on this; I've just been very busy with school lately) — Hmm, that's an interesting idea, thank you. I'm not sure if it's sufficient, because there are cases where SomeType::default is used but the type annotation isn't necessary, and ideally we wouldn't suggestion let a: SomeType there, but I'll keep it in mind
